quote: Anything that's human is mentionable, and anything that is mentionable can be more manageable. When we can talk about our feelings, they become less overwhelming, less upsetting, and less scary. The people we trust with that important talk can help us know that we are not alone.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: We must recognize and nurture the creative parts of each other without always understanding what will be created.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: We must recognize and nurture the creative parts of each other without always understanding what will be created.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: I find I am constantly being encouraged to pluck out some one aspect of myself and present this as the meaningful whole, eclipsing or denying the other parts of self.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: This is how I learned that if I didn't define myself for myself, I would be crunched into other people's fantasies for me and eaten alive.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: I had to examine… the devastating effects of overextension. Overextending myself is not stretching myself. I had to accept how difficult it is to monitor the difference...Crucial. Physically. Psychically. Caring for myself is not self-indulgence, it is self-preservation, and that is an act of political warfare.
author: Audre Lord

quote: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.
author: Brene Brown

quote: Vulnerability is not weakness. And that myth is profoundly dangerous.
author: Brene Brown

quote: When we liberate ourselves from the expectation that we must have all things figured out, we enter a sanctuary of empathy.
author: Sonya Renee Taylor, The Body is not an Apology

quote: Radical self-love demands that we see ourselves and others in the fullness of our complexities and intersections and that we work to create space for those intersections.
author: Sonya Renee Taylor, The Body Is Not an Apology: The Power of Radical Self-Love

quote: When people don't have any curiosity about themselves, that is always a bad sign.
author: Irvin D. Yalom

quote: One of our major tasks in therapy is to pay attention to our immediate feelings—they represent precious data.
author: Irvin D. Yalom, The Gift of Therapy: An Open Letter to a New Generation of Therapists and Their Patients

quote: I'm not perfect... But I'm enough.
author: Carl R. Rogers

quote: Am I living in a way which is deeply satisfying to me, and which truly expresses me?
author: Carl R. Rogers

quote: The good life is a process, not a state of being. It is a direction not a destination.
author: Carl R. Rogers

quote: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
author: Carl R. Rogers, On Becoming a Person: A Therapist's View of Psychotherapy
